definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
shop around first and you won't get ripped off (idiom)
pinyin: huo4 bi3 san1 jia1 bu4 chi1 kui1

sentences.english: "compare the price with several shops, it's boon like buying vegetable in the market".
sentences.chinese: 貨比三家還有東西送，跟菜市場買菜一樣實惠。

sentences.english: So, he "comparison shops, " in much the same way as he would choose a car or house.
sentences.chinese: 他象選房選車一樣的貨比三家地選擇着自己的伴侶。

sentences.english: Price comparison when shopping is also valuable, even (and sometimes especially) when buying expensive items.
sentences.chinese: 在購物時也要學會貨比三家，即使是買奢侈品時。

sentences.english: Comparison-shop by unit price and save.
sentences.chinese: 按單價貨比三家就能省錢。

sentences.english: Some housewives make a habit of shopping around to get the best buy.
sentences.chinese: 購物時貨比三家，是家庭主婦的好習慣。

sentences.english: In order to get a better price, we went to the bicycle shops on Xiyulong Road later.
sentences.chinese: 爲了貨比三家，還去了西玉龍路的自行車店。

sentences.english: We also openly encourage our customers to shop around via our comparison links.
sentences.chinese: 我們還公開鼓勵客戶通過我們的比價鏈接貨比三家。
